severity_system.description: Portuguese profanity severity classification considering Lusophone cultural variations
severity_system.methodology: Based on sociolinguistic research across Portuguese-speaking countries and contemporary usage patterns
severity_system.cultural_context: Reflects regional differences between Brazil, Portugal, and African Portuguese-speaking nations

1.name: Leve (Mild)
1.description: Palavrões leves, aceitáveis em ambientes informais
1.description_en: Mild swear words acceptable in informal settings
1.cultural_notes: These words are often used without serious intent to offend and may be acceptable in casual conversation

2.name: Moderado (Moderate)
2.description: Linguagem grosseira, inadequada na maioria das situações públicas
2.description_en: Coarse language inappropriate in most public situations
2.cultural_notes: Vulgar but widely used; causes moderate offense in mixed company

3.name: Forte (Strong)
3.description: Palavrões fortes, altamente ofensivos na maioria dos contextos
3.description_en: Strong profanity, highly offensive in most contexts
3.cultural_notes: Strong profanity that causes significant social offense, especially in formal contexts

4.name: Severo (Severe)
4.description: Linguagem extremamente ofensiva, tabu no discurso público
4.description_en: Extremely offensive language, taboo in public discourse
4.cultural_notes: Hate speech and extremely vulgar terms; may result in social or legal consequences

regional_variations.description: Geographic location significantly affects severity perception

brazil.notes: Generally more tolerant of profanity, especially anatomical references

portugal.regional_differences: Northern regions more conservative than Lisbon

angola.notes: More conservative due to cultural mixing and colonial legacy
angola.local_influence: Portuguese mixed with local language taboos

mozambique.cultural_factors: Islamic influence in northern regions increases sensitivity

generational_differences.description: Age significantly affects both usage and perception

young_adults_18_30.notes: Much more tolerant, especially of anatomical references

middle_aged_30_60.notes: Traditional attitudes with some modern flexibility

gender_considerations.description: Gender affects both usage permissions and severity perception

female_speakers.notes: Higher social stigma for women using strong profanity
female_speakers.exceptions: Younger urban women face less stigma

male_speakers.notes: More social tolerance for male profanity use

machismo_culture.notes: Traditional gender roles affect both usage and perception

socioeconomic_factors.description: Social class affects profanity tolerance and usage

upper_class.notes: Expected to maintain higher linguistic standards

working_class.notes: More tolerant of profanity in daily communication

practicing_catholics.regional_strength: Stronger in rural areas and older generations

media_context.description: Media platform affects acceptable language levels

internet_social_media.notes: Much more permissive, platform-specific rules apply

print_media.notes: More conservative approach, asterisk censoring common

anatomical_references_brazil.description: Brazilian Portuguese has unique tolerance for anatomical terms
anatomical_references_brazil.media_acceptance: Often uncensored in comedy and casual media

hate_speech.legal_considerations: May violate anti-discrimination laws in Brazil and Portugal
hate_speech.social_consequences: Can result in social ostracism and legal action

compound_insults.description: Multi-word insults often more severe than components
compound_insults.cultural_impact: Compound forms carry extra emotional weight

religious_profanity.regional_variation: Much stronger reaction in rural and religious communities
religious_profanity.context_dependency: Severity depends heavily on speaker's intent and audience

content_filtering.adult_content: All levels may be acceptable with warnings
content_filtering.educational: Only Level 1 acceptable, with pedagogical justification

workplace_policies.blue_collar: Higher tolerance in some manual labor contexts
